result.execSummary:
The defendant Jerry Shevel Washington was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs. Court will waive any costs that can be waived. Court ordered any costs and surcharges that can not be waived to be paid by 08-10-2015 or, if not paid, convert to a civil judgment.
Concurrent with: to case 13CM001904. TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jerry Shevel Washington

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Jerry S Washington
Current: 2111 S. 15th Place, Milwaukee, WI 53215-2641 United States  (Effective: 09-09-2015)
Prior: 5177 North Teutonia Avenue, Milwaukee, WI 53209

Defendant Jerry S Washington in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Defendant Jerry S Washington in custody.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  

AS TO COUNT 2:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered count dismissed and read-in.

AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Court sentenced defendant to serve 45 days in the House of Correction CONCURRENT to case 13CM001904with credit for 45 days served FOR A TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.  Court will waive any costs that can be waived.  Court ordred any costs and surcharges that can not be waived to be paid by 08-10-2015 or, if not paid, convert to a civil judgment.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Attorney Terese M. Dick in court, defendant Jerry S Washington not in court, in custody.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Terese M. Dick in court, defendant Jerry S Washington not in court, in custody.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Defense counsel waives the appearance of the defendant for this hearing only.  The defendant has another case pending.  Defense counsel would like to resolve both cases as part of a global resolution.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring and Supervision.  DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Jerry S Washington in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Defendant Jerry S Washington in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
